column4: hello. gnome and kde are both too heavy for my low-end notebook system. is fluxbox a good choice?
in fact i will try both :)

are there anyone who has installed fluxbox before? i downloaded fluxbox .deb package, but it has a lot of dependencies which i can not get via apt-get. do i have to crawl the web for all the dependencies, or is there a better way?
I am using fluxbox right now
how can i find other packages needed by fluxbox? there are too many and it will take too much time if i try to find them one by one. is there a shortcut?
all you need to do...is type... apt-get install fluxbox
did you get fluxbox running?
not yet, im getting updates, i will try to install it afterwards
correct
you are saying that a DE doesnt need a WM and vice versa right?
they explained it correctly
